title: Frank Lampard sends Chelsea scouts to watch Sergej Milinkovic-Savic in Lazio's defeat at Celtic
text:
Chelsea scouts watched Lazio's Sergej Milinkovic-Savic in their Europa League match at Celtic with Frank Lampard considering the Serbian midfielder as his 'heir'.

The London club are likely to make a move for the 24-year-old at the end of the season once their transfer embargo has been lifted.

In the past, Lazio president Claudio Lotito has refused offers approaching €100million (£86m) for the player he regards as the 'sergeant' of the side.

Chelsea scouts watched Sergej Milinkovic-Savic (left) in Lazio's match with Celtic on Thursday

Milinkovic-Savic is likely to attract plenty of interest from around Europe next summer

Chelsea manager Frank Lampard is an admirer of the Serbian midfielder and wants to sign him

However, it is believed that Milinkovic-Savic would be available for a cheaper price next summer and Chelsea will bid in the region of €60m (£52m).

He had been a long-term target of Juventus but the resistance of Lotito and the hefty price tag eventually deterred the Turin club.

Lampard regards Milinkovic-Savic as a similar midfield player to himself, due to his technical abilities and eye for goal.

He could play Milinkovic-Savic with licence to push forward in the knowledge that N'Golo Kante could cover for him defensively.

A classic box-to-box midfielder because of his strong physique, physicality and speed, it isn't hard to see why Lampard regards him so highly.

It was a disappointing night for Lazio and Milinkovic-Savic as they went down 2-1 to Celtic

The 24-year-old Serbian is considered one of the best box-to-box midfielders in Europe

Milinkovic-Savic at Lazio 2015-present Matches: 174 Goals: 33 Assists: 23 Honours: Italian Cup 2018-19; Italian Super Cup 2017

The Serbian has scored in the Serie A fixture against Genoa and the Europa League game with Rennes so far this season.

Lazio manager Simone Inzaghi is resigned to losing the player in June with several offers from overseas expected to come in.

The Serbia international of 13 caps has been at Lazio since the summer of 2015 and has scored 33 goals and contributed 23 assists in 174 matches during that time.

He helped Lazio win the Italian Cup last season, scoring in their 2-0 win over Atalanta in the final having eliminated both Milan clubs en route.

Lazio manager Simone Inzaghi has resigned himself to losing the midfielder next summer

Lazio are currently seventh in the Serie A standings, a point and a place behind their city rivals Roma.

Milinkovic-Savic played all of their 2-1 defeat at Celtic Park on Thursday night, with Christopher Jullien scoring an 89th-minute winner for Celtic.

Lazio return to league action with a visit to Fiorentina on Sunday evening.
